issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Logical Optimizer
components.description: Optimizations which are independent of runtime.

fields.description:
mvn test -Dtest=TestCliDriver -Dtest.output.overwrite=true -Dqfile=cbo_rp_udf_udaf.q -Dhive.compute.query.using.stats=true repros the issue.

In StatsOptimizer with return path on, we may have aggr($f0), aggr($f1) in GBY
and then select aggr($f1), aggr($f0) in SEL.
Thus we need to use colExp to find out which position is
corresponding to which position.

comments.body:
{code}

{code}

from query:
{code}
select f,a,e,b from (select count(*) as a, count(c_int) as b, sum(c_int) as c, avg(c_int) as d, max(c_int) as e, min(c_int) as f from cbo_t1) cbo_t1
{code}
[~pxiong] Can you take a look at this one?
